prompt: Describe the animal that uses its nose to spray liquid.
icl_complete: Certainly! The animal you're referring to is the skunk. Skunks are small to medium-sized mammals known for their distinctive black and white coloring and their ability to defend themselves by spraying a foul-smelling liquid. This defensive spray is emitted from glands located near the base of the tail and can be accurately directed at potential threats. The odor is not only unpleasant but can also cause temporary blindness and pain if it reaches the eyes. Skunks typically use this defense mechanism as a last resort, after giving warnings such as stamping their feet or raising their tails.
